reasoning:
**Analyzing the Hand: A Quest for Queens and the 3OAK Dream**

Alright, let's get down to business. Ante 6, Boss Blind, and I need 40,000 chips in just four hands. The window is a debuff on Diamonds, thankfully, Chicot disables the window. Current money: $11. I've got Juggler, Wily Joker, Shoot the Moon, Half Joker, Card Sharp, and Chicot working for me. My hand: A♠, K♠, 10♠, 7♠, 6♠, 5♠, 4♠, 3♥, 10♦, 6♦. Not ideal, but we can make something work. My inventory has the Death card (convert) and the Lovers (wild card).

My primary strategy here has to revolve around a Three of a Kind (3OAK), specifically looking to get that +100 chip boost from Wily Joker. With only four discards, this is a race. I also have Shoot the Moon, which rewards Queens. I don't have any yet, but there are six in the deck.

Looking at this hand, I've got a pair of tens, and a whole lot of low cards. Nothing screams out as a keep. I need to discard aggressively. My initial thought was to discard the low cards: 3♥, 4♠, 5♠, 6♠, and 6♦. But, I am sitting with a pair of 10s and I have the Death card.

With the Death card, I could convert the Ace to a 10 and guarantee a 3OAK. That's a minimum of 7,920 points with the current Jokers. If I get the same hand again with Card Sharp active (X3 multiplier) I can come close to 32,000. But if I can get some queens, that will send me over the top. So, discarding is the best play. 

Focusing on the 3OAK play, and aiming for queens. I am going to discard the low cards: 6♠, 5♠, 4♠, 3♥, and 6♦. That gets rid of the junk and gives me a shot at drawing into the Queen strategy.
